channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Blocked manhole, 28th November
item.description:
Dear Bexley Council, The issue is now affecting a number of properties. I am writing to seek clarification regarding the ongoing drainage issues on Pickford Close. As previously confirmed by the Council, the drainage system in this area was constructed in the 1930s, and Council teams have attended on multiple occasions in the past to unblock the drainage system via the manhole on 15 Pickford Close. Given this history, I am confused by the recent statement that you are unable to assist. Residents of Pickford Close, including myself, are fully aware that the Council has regularly attended to this issue and carried out the necessary maintenance when blockages occur. Could you please clarify why assistance is now being declined, despite the long-standing responsibility and previous actions taken by the Council? I would appreciate an explanation and confirmation of the next steps, as this issue continues to affect the residents. Thank you for your attention, and I look forward to your prompt response. Thanks & Regards
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickford Close, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: House stuff left in an area which should be kept clear. Flytipping Saga continues......, 28th November
item.description:
House stuff including toys, books and furniture left in an area which should be kept clear otherwise it attracts further flytipping and is a fire hazard. Lazy irresponsible residents are responsible. toys and books should have gone to a charity shop. Items moved away for ease of collection when the caged van pulls up yet again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pitman Street, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement uneven and damaged, 28th November
item.description:
Pavement has been damaged for many months. Parts of the slabs are uneven with some pieces coming up. There looks to be a temporary repair but the slabs are not level. It is a hazard for people walking and could be dangerous during icy/ rainy conditions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hillingdon Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No lights on the bridge above the highway, 28th November
item.description:
When crossing by the bridge to reach the other side of the “highway” at night, it is pitch black, gloomy and looks dark and unsafe because there is no light on the bridge. When it’s night, I have to use my phone lamp torch to see the path. Also there are debris on this bridge and sometimes people hanging around. Please add some lights! this is not acceptable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bowes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped sofas, 28th November
item.description:
There are two separate sofas and chairs dumped, one on either side of the road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cumbrian Avenue, North End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ref: 8354962 unsolved issue. Trip hazards., 28th November
item.description:
Only part of the pavement has been fixed from my "solved issue", and the bit that has been fixed is absolutely shocking. No care taken in the look of it at all. Clearly this isn't being signed off by any supervisor as it looks like a blind person has screeded this concrete. As I said in my first complaint, the WHOLE pavement needs re doing in the whole of Dane Close. My mum recently tripped and pulled her muscle in her leg and she's nearly 70. Myself, or others will sue if any further injuries do occure as this has been complained about. As I have said before the road is full of elderly people, one in particular who is scared to use his mobility scooter because of the risk of falling out of it. This needs sorting. James Ball
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Dane Close, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, noisy manholes and uneven road, 28th November
item.description:
The road is in need of serious repair. There are potholes, broken/noisy manholes and uneven footing which is likely cause accidents. Heavy bin trucks travel up and down the road, and causes serious noise and disturbance to surrounding buildings.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Elsdale Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
